Class ScarletGemMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • ScarletGemMain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class ScarletGemMain
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.print.Printable, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    This is the 'Main' class for this project. All of the event listeners used in the game are implemented by this class. This class will respond to any buttons pressed in any other classes. This class acts as the "brain" of the project: it does all of the logic, processing and recordkeeping. The other classes are just utility classes that help to store temporary game data (such as the question sets for each country) and display the GUI.
    Version:
    1.0 17.05.15
    Author:
    Zachary Teper (13 hours) and Angela Zhu (3 hours)
    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • COUNTRIES

        public static final Country[] COUNTRIES
        Holds the instances of each country in the game. These are the indexes of each country in this array:
        • 0 - Canada
        • 1 - China
        • 2 - Mexico
        • 3 - USA
        • 4 - Portugal
        • 5 - Australia
        • 6 - Egypt
        • 7 - India
        • 8 - Russia
        • 9 - Japan
        • 10 - France
        • 11 - England

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScarletGemMain

        public ScarletGemMain()
        Displays the splash screen, initializes the game variables and displays the main menu. Adds ActionListeners and KeyListeners to game Objects. Try block reads in splashscreen image. Try block reads in logo and title image. Try blocks read in backgrounds for each country. Local Variables

        imageLabel JLabel - holds the splashscreen background.

        infoLabel JLabel - holds the splashscreen information message.

        logoLabel JLabel - holds the company logo.

        splashImage ImageIcon - holds the splashscreen background image.

        title JLabel - holds the title image.

        splashScreen JPanel - holds the panel displayed at the start of the game.

        canadaEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for Canada.

        canadaMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for Canada.

        canadaHard Question[] - holds the hard questions for Canada.

        canada Country - holds the Country instance for Canada.

        chinaEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for china.

        chinaMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for china.

        chinaHard Question[] - holds the hard questions for china.

        china Country - holds the Country instance for china.

        usaEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for usa.

        usaMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for usa.

        usaHard Question[] - holds the hard questions for usa.

        usa Country - holds the Country instance for usa.

        mexicoEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for mexico.

        mexicoMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for mexico.

        mexicoHard Question[] - holds the hard questions for mexico.

        mexico Country - holds the Country instance for mexico.

        portugalEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for portugal.

        portugalMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for portugal.

        portugalHard Question[] - holds the hard questions for portugal.

        portugal Country - holds the Country instance for portugal.

        australiaEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for australia.

        australiaMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for australia.

        australiaHard Question[] - holds the hard questions for australia.

        australia Country - holds the Country instance for australia.

        egyptEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for egypt.

        egyptMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for egypt.

        egypt Country - holds the Country instance for egypt.

        indiaEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for india.

        indiaMedium Question[] - holds the medium questions for india.

        india Country - holds the Country instance for india.

        russiaEasy Question[] - holds the easy questions for russia.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Processes action events from all of the Buttons and Menus throughout the game. Called by the JVM when a Button or Menu is pressed. If statements control which block of code will be executed based on ae If statement in progress reading section sets the number of levels remaining. If statement in pause button processing calculates whether to pause or unpause. While loop in progress reading section keeps reading until it reaches a blank line. Try block in help button section runs execution of .chm file. Try block in progress reading section reads in from file. Try block in about dialog section reads in the background and logo image.

        Local Variables

        job PrinterJob - the printer job to print the high scores.

        file File - the .chm file to be displayed.

        about JFrame - the About dialog window.

        aboutPanel JPanel - the Panel which holds the window components.

        infoLabel JLabel - contains contact info about the game.

        background JLabel - holds the background of the About dialog.

        logo ImageIcon - holds the CakeSoft logo.

        logoLabel JLabel - holds the ImageIcon specified by logo

        in BufferedReader - reads in the progress file.

        next String - holds the value of the next line in the progress file.

        total int - holds the total number of levels in each difficulty mode.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - ActionEvent - the action which occured.

      • difficultyString

        public java.lang.String difficultyString()
        Returns the String representation of the current difficulty. If statements control return statements.
        Returns:
        String the String represenation of the difficulty.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        resets game variables, closes the game screen, and returns to the main menu. Asks user for username, asks if he/she would like to continue. If statement checks if the game has been won. If statement checks if the username is not null before adding it to High Scores. If statement checks if the difficulty is not Hard. If statement checks if the user wants to continue, and if the difficulty is not Hard. If statement checks if the difficulty is Easy. Local Variables

        next int - holds whether the user wants to continue.

      • print

        public int print(java.awt.Graphics page,
                 java.awt.print.PageFormat format,
                 int index)
        Sends a print command to the printer specified in the dialog box. If statement checks if the index is greater than 0. For loops and if statements print names and scores, will break if the loop reaches a blank line. Try block reads in the logo.
        Specified by:
        print in interface java.awt.print.Printable
        Parameters:
        page - Graphics the page to be printed
        format - PageFormat the format of the page to be printed
        index - int the page index to be printed
        Returns:
        int Returns Printable.PAGE_EXISTS or Printable.NO_SUCH_PAGE
